repnme.cdata!: Cote d'Ivoire - Second Water Supply Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Second Water Supply
            Project for Cote d'Ivoire was satisfactory. The project
            achieved or exceeded most of it objectives, its impact on
            institutional development was moderate, sustainability is
            uncertain, and the performance of both the Bank and Borrower
            was satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, the association of a SECAL operation and an
            ongoing investment operation is a practical alternative to a
            hybrid loan. Second, centralized maintenance of scattered
            rural facilities is not sustainable, even if it is carried
            out by a private company. Third, a technical department of
            the central government that is deprived of financial
            incentives and accountability should not be expected manage
            and make responsible investment decisions. Finally, projects
            that aim at developing the connection ratio and water
            services to the urban poor should systematically measure the
            actual willingness to pay of low-income domestic users and
            take into account the consumers' surplus.

repnme.cdata!: Ivory Coast - Second Water Supply Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Water Supply Project
            includes: (i) investments in the Abidjan system to increase
            water production facilities, increase storage capacity,
            provide for a 7 km transmission main and reinforcing the
            distribution system, as well as continuation of studies on
            available groundwater resources and study of a centralized
            production and water pressure control system; (ii) about 300
            km of distribution extensions in 51 secondary centers; (iii)
            about 10,000 house connections to provide service for poor
            segments of the population under the social connection
            program; (iv) about 300 drilled village wells; (v)
            consultants services to carry out sector studies, land
            surveys, project supervision, technical assistance to DCH
            and FNH and training; and (vi) supply and installation of
            computer equipment for the Cadastre and property tax administration.

docna.cdata!: Ivory Coast - Second Water Supply Project

display_title.display_title: Ivory Coast - Second Water Supply Project
